moduleCode:
--Decoder with 4-bit input that returns a 7-bit output with the segments that should be on.
--Could add an option to adapt if the catodes are active at high-level or not.
library IEEE;
use IEEE.STD_LOGIC_1164.ALL;
entity <NAME> is
    Port ( <INPUT> : in  STD_LOGIC_VECTOR (3 downto 0);  --number from 0 to F
           <SEGMENTS> : out  STD_LOGIC_VECTOR (6 downto 0);
           );
end <NAME>;
architecture Behavioral of <NAME> is
begin
process(<INPUT>)
begin
    case <INPUT> is
    when "0000" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0000001"; -- "0"     
    when "0001" => <SEGMENTS> <= "1001111"; -- "1" 
    when "0010" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0010010"; -- "2" 
    when "0011" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0000110"; -- "3" 
    when "0100" => <SEGMENTS> <= "1001100"; -- "4" 
    when "0101" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0100100"; -- "5" 
    when "0110" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0100000"; -- "6" 
    when "0111" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0001111"; -- "7" 
    when "1000" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0000000"; -- "8"     
    when "1001" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0000100"; -- "9" 
    when "1010" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0000010"; -- a
    when "1011" => <SEGMENTS> <= "1100000"; -- b
    when "1100" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0110001"; -- C
    when "1101" => <SEGMENTS> <= "1000010"; -- d
    when "1110" => <SEGMENTS> <= "0110000"; -- E
    when others => <SEGMENTS> <= "0111000"; -- F 
    end case;
end process;
end Behavioral;
